Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Health Psychology
Description: Examines the psychological factors influencing health, illness, and healthcare.
Requirements: At least 5 ‘O’ Level passes including English Language, Mathematics and a relevant Science subject at Grade C or better, plus A minimum of any 2 “A” Level passes.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours Organisational and Industrial Psychology
Description: Applies psychological principles to workplace issues, including organizational behavior and human resources.
Requirements: At least 5 ‘O’ Level passes including English Language, Mathematics and a relevant Science subject at Grade C or better, plus A minimum of any 2 “A” Level passes.

Name: Master of Science in Clinical Psychology
Description: Advanced training in the assessment, diagnosis, and treatment of mental health disorders.
Requirements: Minimum of an upper second class (2.1) in a BSc Honours Degree in Psychology.

Name: Master of Science in Community Psychology
Description: Focuses on understanding and addressing psychological issues within communities.
Requirements: Minimum of a lower second class (2.2) in a BSc Honours Degree in Psychology.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Industrial Sociology
Description: Examines social structures and dynamics within industrial and organizational settings.
Requirements: Any two ‘A’ Level passes in Arts, Humanities and Social Sciences subjects.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Sociology and Social Policy
Description: Studies social structures, human behavior, and the development of social policies.
Requirements: Any two ‘A’ Level passes in Arts, Humanities and Social Sciences subjects.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Migration and Population Movements
Description: Focuses on the causes, patterns, and impacts of human migration and population changes.
Requirements: Any two ‘A’ Level passes in Arts, Humanities and Social Sciences subjects.

Name: Master of Science Honours in Sociology and Social Anthropology
Description: Advanced study in sociological theories and anthropological research methods.
Requirements: A 2.1 Pass in either BSc Sociology or BSc Anthropology.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours Degree in Geography and Environmental Sustainability
Description: Examines geographical processes and their relationship to environmental sustainability.
Requirements: Advanced Level Geography and any other Advanced Level subject and 5 Ordinary Level passes OR National Foundation Certificates including Mathematics and English Language.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours Degree in Environmental Disaster Risk Management and Resilience Building
Description: Focuses on managing risks associated with environmental disasters and building community resilience.
Requirements: A pass in Advanced Level Geography and any other Advanced Level subject AND 5 Ordinary Level passes/ National Foundation Certificates including Mathematics and English Language OR National Certificate.
